thread.title: Watch Gronk, J.J. Watt, and Other NFL Stars Read Mean Tweets About Themselves
thread.title_full: Watch Gronk, J.J. Watt, and Other NFL Stars Read Mean Tweets About Themselves

author: Barry K
title: Watch Gronk, J.J. Watt, and Other NFL Stars Read Mean Tweets About Themselves
text:
Your Privacy Rights Canadian Customers 
When Twitter user @Super_Strat fired up his tweeting machine and accused New England Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski of being illiterate, he never thought he’d end up on the latest edition of Jimmy Kimmel Live ’s hilarious franchise, “Celebrities Read Mean Tweets.” But Gronk replied that he indeed could read (obviously, he’s reading the tweet), and fired back with unparalleled wit: “I just read it. You’re stupid.” Okay, so Gronk isn’t the quickest with words, but here’s the thing, @Super_Strat: It appears you’re a Bills fan, which means you basically got owned all season long. 
A host of other A-list NFL players lined up to get cyber-bullied on national television, and boy was it entertaining. Odell Beckham Jr. read that he’d become an “extremely lame looking d**khead in an alarmingly short amount of time,” and J.J. Watt was told he looked like a “fat Macklemore.” Twitter user @YungEmac told Tony Romo he sat down to pee (Romo didn’t dispute it), and Terrell Davis told user @realprinceblue, “F**k you too!” after user Ben Simmons said he was “acting like a real McA**Hole right now.” Did these insults cut deep into the psyches of wildly successful men, envied by their peers and worth millions and millions of dollars? Probably not, so we’re glad they let average Joe Twitter users have a field day as a consolation prize. Watch the segment here: Advertisement
